name: 2-amino-6-fluoropyridine
Reason:
The compound 2-amino-6-fluoropyridine can be broken down into the contributions of its functional groups to predict its melting point: 
- Basic unit, pyridine has a melting point of 6.5°C. 
- Fluorine (F): adds significantly since it introduces electronegativity and polarizability, which increases intermolecular forces. An estimated effect could be around +10°C to +15°C due to the polar nature of the C-F bond. 
- Amino group (NH2): forms hydrogen bonds, which tend to increase the melting point. An educated estimate for this effect is +20°C to +30°C. 
- The fluorine and amino groups interact with each other, which may lead to an additional synergistic effect. This can be estimated at around +5°C. 
Considering these adjustments, the values are summation of the estimated effects.
